txt.en: 'Fool!'
'Not just Orcs, but Mordorrim too.'
'You will rue the day you did not slay Urudanî Stonemaiden!'
'I hear shouting to the west!'
'I see them!'
'Be cautious, my friends! That is Urudanî Stonemaiden, and she is most deadly!'
'Hold, my friend! She is defeated.'
Talk to Vëamacil
'Vëamacil, stay the killing blow!'
Talk to Magoldir outside Amon Fuin
'Slay them yourself.'
'I am not dying for some Gúrzyul witch.'
'To me, boys!'
DNT - Blah!
Defeat the look-outs outside Amon Fuin with Vëamacil and Ornaher
You failed to protect your allies!
'Keep your eyes open, Ornaher!'
You and the sons of Isildur have encountered Magoldir the Elf outside Amon Fuin.
'I know I said it was quiet, but this is curiously so.'
'Where are the guards? Where are the true warriors?'
'All is quiet, but do not trust the stillness! There will be look-outs up ahead, and we should dispatch them quickly before they can raise the alarm. Are you ready?'
Magoldir wants you to advise Vëamacil and Ornaher to abandon their mission to Amon Fuin.
'We are not afraid of you or your master!'
'Aye, brother!'
DNT - Blah!
'Well, Urudanî? What have you to say now?'
'Wait, someone comes! Not within the camp, but without!'

'I saw you from afar, my friend, and came to lend you any assistance you might require. And this too: a warning 'gainst this course! Was this excursion to Amon Fuin your idea, or that of these sons of Isildur?\n\n'It is true that there is less activity here than there was of late, but Amon Fuin is still a place of evil and will not be undefended. This seems to me an unwise course, and I beg you convince these two to turn back, for the Great Alliance will be the worse for it should something befall them.'
'Farewell, Urudanî! Your life is at its end!
'The Elf has heard of me.'
'Hail, Magoldir.'
The sons of Isildur have charged forward into Amon Fuin, dismissing the warnings of Magoldir.
'I will remedy that now, Ornaher, fear not.'
'You would be wise to heed his warning!'
'I fear no darkness!'

'Yes, I hear Magoldir's warning, but the evil of the Mordorrim must be opposed, and who better to do so than the sons of Isildur? Good soldiers have been spirited away by some evil ruse, and we must find them if we can!'
'That was poorly-done, Magoldir.'
'What soldiers are those?'

'Magoldir's warning is well-intentioned, but you must understand that we cannot allow good soldiers of the Alliance to remain in torment within Amon Fuin. We have no choice! It is up to Isildur's sons to save them, and we will not shrink from that purpose!'
'The men who come to Sauron's service come willingly.'
Fight alongside Magoldir as he ventures into Amon Fuin
'As do we all!'
'Kill them, my servants! Kill them for Sauron!'

'That was... unexpected.'

Magoldir hefts his sword.

'I suppose we need to follow them. Their father will not look kindly upon us were we to abandon them now, although it seems to this observer that they were the ones who abandoned us. Even so, this is our duty.'
'These Orcs will prove too much for you.'
DNT - Blah!
'Bring me their heads!'
DNT - Blah!
'What?'
DNT - Blah!
Defeat Urudanî Stonemaiden
'Yes, Mistress Urudanî!'
Vëamacil and Ornaher are outside the walls of Amon Fuin.
Stand alongside Magoldir and the sons of Isildur in Amon Fuin
<rgb=#FF0000>All of your allies must survive</rgb>
'She poses no further threat.'
'Killing her now would make us no better than Orcs.'
Urudanî Stonemaiden commands the Mordorrim cultists within Amon Fuin.
'Mercy must never be a mistake, Vëamacil.'
Urudanî's cultists have been defeated, and her contingent of Orcs has abandoned her, but she still intends to stand and fight.
'A pox on them!\n\n'I did not need those cowards before, and I do not need them now! I will slay you myself, and exult in your demise!'
Magoldir has fallen, and you have failed
The sons of Isildur weigh what should be done with Urudanî Stonemaiden. She has been defeated, but while she lives she remains a threat to the Great Alliance.

'I hate to leave without the success for which we hoped, but I see no other choice. There is no sign of our missing soldiers, and from the words of Urudanî Stonemaiden I fear we are not likely to see them again.

'Magoldir should not have had us spare her. If she works some mischief upon the works of the Great Alliance it will be upon his head, and no other.

'Bah! Let us leave this place, friend. It is not safe to remain here, no matter its unusual quiet.'
Vëamacil and Ornaher, two of the sons of Isildur, are eager to conduct a dangerous rescue mission into the enemy-held fortress of Amon Fuin.
'Are you prepared to die, Mordorrim witch?'
'Where are the soldiers you abducted?'
'Your lackeys are no match for us, Urudanî Stonemaiden!'
'But she lives, and should not.'
'Magoldir, she is evil.'
'Well, she is gone now, and our missing soldiers are beyond our help.'
Talk to Vëamacil and Ornaher and convince them not to proceed into Amon Fuin
'Without fail, Vëamacil!'
Talk to Magoldir outside Amon Fuin
'I expected trolls.'
'It is that Elf!'
'Nor do I!'
Defeat the guards that defend Urudanî Stonemaiden
Talk to Urudanî Stonemaiden in Amon Fuin
Instance: All Is Quiet
'Follow me, mellon!'
'I will slay you all, and bring you to Sauron myself!'
'Orcs, up ahead! They will hinder the retreat of the sons of Isildur...'
'I seek no mercy!'
'...unless we do something, that is!'
